Notes: chatting is usually a more synchronous, faster form of communication, implying immediate responses and rapid changes of turn

Asynchronous communication channels with unlimited buffer size (e. g. e-mail) tend to be more similar to traditional written speech, whereas synchronous channels, especially with limited buffer size (instant messaging), are more similar to oral speech
First of all, the need for speed leads to a weakening of the norm
The sentences are shorter in chat, due to the higher speed of communication
The lack of sentence end marks and capital letters occurs for two reasons. First of all, the need for speed leads to a weakening of the norm.
The lack of sentence end marks and capital letters occurs for two reasons. First of all, the need for speed leads to a weakening of the norm.

Emoticons are more numerous in chat, since in a synchronous mode it is more important to show a “polite smile” to an interlocutor. They also have a phatic function: you are showing that you are interested in what your partner is saying, and you might reply to a message with a single smiling emoticon if you do not have anything else to say.
